result.markdown:
::: {.question} **Net Proceeds in an SEO** Orion AutoTech executed a seasoned equity offering (SEO) of 16 million shares at $29.18 per share. Of these, 8.8 million were primary (new shares issued by the company) and 7.2 million were secondary (sold by existing investors). Assume the underwriter charges 5.5% of the gross proceeds as an underwriting fee which is shared proportionately between the primary and secondary shares. ::: {.question-block}
1. The amount of money raised by the company (in million USD) is:
✅ Net to issuer = (Primary Shares × Price) − Underwriter fee on primary = (8.8 × $29.18) − (5.5% × $256.78 million) = $256.78 million − $14.12 million = **$242.7 million**.
::: ::: {.question-block}
2. The amount of money raised by the VC (in million USD) is:
✅ Net to VCs = (Secondary Shares × Price) − Underwriter fee on secondary = (7.2 × $29.18) − (5.5% × $210.1 million) = $210.1 million − $11.56 million = **$198.5 million**.
::: ::: {.question-block}
3. The amount of money the underwriter will earn (in million USD) is:
✅ Fee = (Total Shares × Price) × Fee Rate = (16 × $29.18) × 5.5% = $466.88 million × 5.5% = **$25.7 million**.
::: :::
